name: A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No. 24
summary: This circular revises operational aspects of Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPI) investments in debt securities. Key changes include: relaxation of minimum residual maturity requirements for government securities and corporate bonds, increase in aggregate FPI investment cap in Central Government securities to 30%, introduction of online monitoring of G-sec utilization limits replacing auction mechanism, establishment of concentration limits for different categories of FPIs, and new restrictions on corporate bond investments including single/group investor limits and prohibition of investment in partly paid instruments.
questions: What is the new cap on aggregate FPI investments in any Central Government security?
From what date will the auction mechanism for G-sec limits be discontinued?
What is the concentration limit for Long-term FPIs in each debt category?
What is the maximum exposure limit for an FPI to a single corporate in its corporate bond portfolio?
Are FPIs allowed to invest in partly paid instruments under the new regulations?
